statement.p: The optimal angle for an extension ladder is \displaystyle{75}^{\circ}. This angle is measured from the middle of the rails (center of a foot). The angle is approximated by placing the feet of the ladder 1/4 the length of the ladder from where the rails rest at the top. The foot of a ladder is about 4" long. When placing the ladder the a person might measure the distance to either edge or the middle of the feet. We ask if this makes a significant difference in the angle.
Suppose the ladder is 154 inches long. For each of the following use the distance from the edge to the middle of the feet to calculate the angle.
If the distance is measured to the middle of the foot, what is the angle?
If the distance is measured to the wall side of the foot (so the middle is 2 inches further away), what is the angle?
If the distance is measured to the far side of the foot (so the middle is 2 inches closer), what is the angle?
Does the difference in angle exceed \displaystyle{2}^{\circ} (which would not have a significant safety impact)?
